youtube.com

Thousands of asylum seekers from Haiti who were denied entry in the United States two years ago have established a community on Mexico's northwestern border....Thousands of asylum seekers from Haiti who were denied entry in the United States two years ago have established a community on Mexico's northwestern border....
item.author: Abolish ICE Denver

item.title: This a message to the public on the topic of immigration. Many...
item.content:encoded:
Abolish ICE Denver

This a message to the public on the topic of immigration. Many believe that as Biden entered office things would change but much seems to contain the same inhumanity as these pictures can demonstrate. These actions are inhumane that no one should ever go through. People coming from places where poverty is such an immense problem that it obligates them to migrate risking so much on the way here in search of a solution and they come to find this type of abuse. A lot within and ...outside this country on the topic of immigration has not changed. We keep fighting for a legalization for the more than 11 million immigrants placing hope that this legalization will be included in the reconciliation budget but we see that they keep placing obstacles with their political games. It is time that the community stands up now that during the pandemic immigrants were and are essential workers who were on the front lines exposing our health and lives so this country can stay on its feet. It is just that they give citizenship to all now that for decades nothing has been done. Now that there is a possibility, Congress continues to play. Come join us this Saturday at 11am on 29th and Federal in order to get demand that we receive citizenship for all. Join us and back our immigrant community. It does not matter who may be leading this or what organization are involved this is about searching for justice for our 11 million. Hope to see you there!

item.title: Citizen for immigrants now
item.content:encoded:
Abolish ICE Denver

Citizen for immigrants now

FIRM Action was live.

NOW: The march has made it to ICE Headquarters.

Thousands of people from all over the country are marching for citizenship, care, and climate in Washington, D.C. today. #WeAreHome

item.title: Today is the. Last day please share and suport
item.content:encoded:
Abolish ICE Denver

Today is the. Last day please share and suport

Abolish ICE Denver

Gaby has been fighting for over a year alone in this country, has been a member for over a year at Sanctuary for All, and continues to fight to be here with her children. supports her struggle by buying food that week after week each family cooks lovingly for you.

Happy Hispanic and Latinx Heritage Month! üéâ

In celebration, we've curated five amazing TED.com and TEDxMileHigh recommendations!

1. America Ferrera: https://bit....ly/my-identity-is-a-superpower
2. Jeanette Vizguerra: https://bit.ly/no-son-v√≠ctimas
3. Gabby Rivera: https://bit.ly/marvel-queer-latina-superhero
4. Alejandro Jimenez: https://bit.ly/machismo-hurts-men-too
5. Lolita: https://bit.ly/toda-mi-gente

Watch them all and come back to tell us which speech or performance was your favorite ‚ù§Ô∏è

Psst - there's many more amazing Latinx speakers and performers on our website, this barely scratches the surface. Visit tedxmilehigh.com for more!

item.title: Con demasiada frecuencia, los medios estadounidenses presentan a...
item.content:encoded:
Abolish ICE Denver

Con demasiada frecuencia, los medios estadounidenses presentan a los inmigrantes indocumentados como v√≠ctimas indefensas, pero eso no es la verdad. En esta fascinante presentaci√≥n, Jeanette Vizguerra cuenta su historia de cruzar la frontera, encontrar trabajo en los Estados Unidos y luchar por sus derechos. Es una historia de lucha, de dificultades, de coraje, de determinaci√≥n y, sobre todo, de resistencia. Jeanette Vizguerra es una orgullosa mujer mexicana, madre y abuela co...n 23 a√±os en los Estados Unidos como inmigrante. Se mud√≥ a los Estados Unidos para ser conserje, trabaj√≥ como organizadora sindical y construy√≥ su propia empresa. Despu√©s de ocho a√±os de luchar contra la deportaci√≥n, hizo p√∫blica su historia y busc√≥ refugio en First Unitarian Society of Denver. Fund√≥ Metro Denver Sanctuary Coalition, Sanctuary4All y Abolish ICE Denver. Fue nombrada una de las 100 personas m√°s influyentes de la revista Time en 2017, pero sigue siendo un ser simple y humilde lleno de sue√±os e ideas.

//

Too often the US media portrays undocumented immigrants as helpless victims, but that is not the truth. In this fascinating presentation, Jeanette Vizguerra tells her story of crossing the border, finding work in the United States, and fighting for her rights. After eight years of fighting deportation, she went public with her story and sought refuge with the First Unitarian Society of Denver. She founded Metro Denver Sanctuary Coalition, Sanctuary4All, and Abolish ICE Denver. She was named one of Time Magazine's 100 Most Influential People in 2017, but she remains a simple and humble being full of dreams and ideas.

¬°Mira aqu√≠! // Watch here!
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=PboUY0A-JYQ

item.title: Gaby has been an incredible advocate not only for herself but...
item.content:encoded:
Abolish ICE Denver

Gaby has been an incredible advocate not only for herself but other families in sanctuary for all, she has helped other families cook their solidarity meals and flyer the neighborhood about our events! We are so grateful to everything she brings to sanctuary for all, support her fight and help keep her here by ordering solidarity meals this Saturday! https://solidaritymeals.paperform.co.

Abolish ICE Denver

Gaby has been fighting for over a year alone in this country, has been a member for over a year at Sanctuary for All, and continues to fight to be here with her children. supports her struggle by buying food that week after week each family cooks lovingly for you.

item.title: Today President Biden will be at National Renewable Energy...
item.content:encoded:
Abolish ICE Denver

Today President Biden will be at National Renewable Energy Laboratory. He will be leaving Colorado at 5pm and it is a great opportunity for community to be present to send a message with all the topics that affect us. Community stand up and fight! 15013 Denver West Pkwy
Golden, CO 80401
United States

The Hudson County Correctional Facility in New Jersey says it will no longer detain people for Immigration and Customs Enforcement (ICE), Documented reports. item.title: Abolish ICE DenverMinority Humanitarian FoundationA video clip from yesterday‚Äôs family reunion. This was this Cameroonian couple‚Äôs first...
item.content:encoded:
Abolish ICE DenverMinority Humanitarian Foundation

A video clip from yesterday‚Äôs family reunion. This was this Cameroonian couple‚Äôs first embrace in almost three years!

Backstory: We met our dear friend about tw...o years ago when he was released from ICE Detention. We picked him up and housed him while we arranged his travel through our amazing partners Miles4Migrants. We explained the process of what he needed to do to secure his family visas, and he jumped through every single hoop to make it happen.

This amazing husband and father has worked tirelessly since November 2019, dreaming of the day that he would embrace his wife and hug his children once again. Yesterday was that day. A huge thank you to the very special Miles4Migrants donor who reunited this family today. Humanity knows no borders. #welcomehome

item.title: Invitaci√≥n a la comunidad ven y acomp√°√±anos con el proyecto...
item.content:encoded:
Abolish ICE Denver

Invitaci√≥n a la comunidad ven y acomp√°√±anos con el proyecto Art√≠stico de Michelle √Ångels y tres mujeres guerreras de colorado habr√° m√∫sica con nuestro amigo Andy Gonzalez, comida echa por R.T Catering de una Recipipde Daca Tania Tabullo Baez, y diferentes colaboradores art√≠sticos en el proyecto Familias Separadas, Ginny Calderon, Ingrid Ivett Encalada ,Jeanette Vizguerra contando sus historias y luchas por permanecer con sus familias atravez del arte acomp√°√±anos y celebra con... nosotros la resistencia de las familias inmigrantes.

Invitation to the community come and join us with the Artistic project of Michelle Angels and three female warriors from Colorado there will be music with our friend Andy Gonzalez, food made by RT Catering from a Recipipde Daca Tania Tabullo Baez, and different artistic collaborators in the Separated Families project , Ginny Calderon, Ingrid Ivett Encalada, Jeanette Vizguerra telling their stories and struggles to stay with their families through art, join us and celebrate with us the resistance of immigrant families.
